item.title: Erosion ‘Gameplay Walkthrough’ video
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

A four-minute guide through an early quest in the game.

Publisher Lyrical Games and developer Plot Twist have released a four-minute gameplay walkthrough video of Erosion, the newly announced Wild West open-world time-looping roguelike action game.

The footage guides viewers through an early quest in the game and highlights how the different choices players make ripple across timelines.

Here is a brief overview of the game, via Lyrical Games:

Erosion is a time-looping open-world roguelike that fuses chaotic action and meaningful narrative in a living post-apocalyptic Wild West, where every death advances a decade.

Journey across time to save your daughter from a ruthless warlord, where failure means another chance, but at a devastating cost. Explore a faction-divided wasteland to build your arsenal and reshape the fates of its eccentric inhabitants across shifting timelines. Join a chicken cult, steal a slick new ride, race it to earn Cheddar, then gamble it all away in the Al Cashino. Descend into the mysterious Pillar to battle through chaotic, destructible dungeons, fighting to get one step closer to saving your daughter or losing her entirely to time itself.

Erosion is due out in Early Access for Xbox Series and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store in spring 2026, followed by a full release across PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC later in 2026.

item.title: Destiny 2: Renegades expansion launch trailer, ‘Making of a Renegade’ video documentary
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

A new look ahead of the expansion's December 2 release.

Bungie has released the launch trailer and a new video documentary for the Star Wars-inspired Destiny 2: Renegades expansion ahead of its December 2 release.

Here are the latest details:

Today, Destiny 2 developers hosted a dedicated Developer Live Stream for Renegades, the upcoming expansion in the Year of Prophecy, created in collaboration with Lucasfilm Games and inspired by Star Wars. To mark the expansion’s release next week on December 2, 2025, the team premiered the Destiny 2: Renegades launch trailer and a second ViDoc, “Making of a Renegade,” highlighting their creative process and collaboration with Lucasfilm Games to create an all-new Destiny 2 experience with clear homage to Star Wars.

Renegades introduces an arsenal of new weapons and gear, including the Praxic Blade, Destiny 2‘s lightsaber-inspired kinetic Exotic Sword. This new weapon offers multiple customization paths that meaningfully impact gameplay, along with earnable cosmetics that alter the color of the blade. Renegades also debuts a new weapon archetype, Blasters, which features a heat-based firing and reload system that replaces traditional magazines.

New Exotics arriving with Renegades include:

  • Kinetic Sword – Praxic Blade (inspired by lightsabers)
  • Solar Crossbow – Heirloom (inspired by Chewbacca’s iconic weapon)
  • Strand Machine Gun – Service of Luzaku
  • Warlock Helmet – Deimosuffusion
  • Hunter Legs – Fortune’s Favor
  • Titan Chest – Praxic Vestment

During the stream, members of the Destiny 2 developer team dove deep into the Lawless Frontier, a new activity designed for replayability and scalable challenge. In Renegades, players build reputation with shady Syndicate factions through the new Notoriety system, taking on a range of solo or three-person missions commissioned by three distinct factions:

  • The Pikers – An anarchist and atheist biker gang of Eliksni seeking to build a society free from traditional ranks and hierarchy.
  • Tharsis Reformation – A breakaway sect of sentient Vex, driven by a desire to experience personal identity outside the Vex collective.
  • Totality Division – A rogue branch of the Barant Imperium Cabal, operating as a Syndicate on Mars and ruled by psions.
  • ❮
  • ❯

Job types include Smuggling runs to transport valuable goods between Syndicate facilities, Bounty Hunts that track and eliminate high-value targets, and Sabotage operations that disrupt rival Syndicate strongholds. Lawless Frontier features new maps set on Mars, Europa, and Venus, expanding these destinations with fresh routes and combat spaces. The update also introduces the new Invasion mode, an opt-in feature which allows a Guardian to spawn into the playing field to disrupt progress and earn unique rewards.

Renegades Abilities are powerful tools that let Guardians bend the rules of combat within the Lawless Frontier mode. Guardians can earn, upgrade, and deploy a wide arsenal of offensive, defensive, and support abilities to enhance their abilities and role in battle.

The new dungeon, Equilibrium, launches on December 13, 2025, at 9:00 a.m. PT / 12:00 p.m. ET. Fans can tune into the official Equilibrium Dungeon Race stream with Evanf1997 and CBGray starting at 6:00 a.m. PT / 9:00 a.m. ET with the pre-show until the race is completed. More information on the race can be found in the This Week in Destiny blog, and for full details on eligibility and requirements for the Equilibrium Dungeon Race, please visit Bungie’s official rules.

Destiny 2: Renegades launches on December 2, 2025. Players can pre-order the Year of Prophecy Ultimate Edition, which includes both The Edge of Fate and Renegades campaigns, The Desert Perpetual raid, and the upcoming dungeon. Pre-ordering Renegades through this edition instantly unlocks these bonus in-game rewards:

  • Renegade Leader Exotic ship
  • Starside Introduction emblem
  • New Land Beyond Exotic Sniper Rifle with its ornament and catalyst
  • Dark Side Legends bundle
  • Enneachord Exotic Sparrow

Players who already own the Renegades Standard Edition or the Year of Prophecy Standard Edition can upgrade to the Ultimate Edition, which grants access to all exclusive content and rewards included in the Year of Prophecy Ultimate Edition.

Destiny 2 is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC via Steam.

item.title: HORSES launches December 2
item.content:encoded:
• PC

First-person horror adventure from Santa Ragione.

First-person horror adventure game HORSES will launch for PC via Epic Games Store, GOG, itch.io, and Humble Store on December 2, developer Santa Ragione announced. It will not be available on Steam, as the game was banned from the platform without a detailed explanation by Valve.

Here is an overview of the game, via Santa Ragione:

About

An enigmatic first-person horror adventure that blurs the line between reality and the darkest corners of your imagination. Fourteen days, a horse farm, and a few rules to follow.

Take a break from your college coursework and spend the summer helping out on a secluded farm.

The air is warm, the horses are quiet, and the people are down-to-earth. Each day brings new tasks, and the work itself is simple, even if the goals are a little unclear. Sometimes, after the sun sets on a productive day, there are even activities to be found in the evenings.

Over the course of fourteen days, it welcomes you into encounters that test your obedience, complicity, and restraint.

Key Features

  • Immerse yourself in the eerie fusion of gameplay and full-motion video intermissions.
  • Witness the farm’s unspeakable horrors through daily unique interactions.
  • Heed the farmer’s warnings or face consequences (?)
  • Withstand 14 days of spiraling dread as the reality of the farm unfolds.
  • A full playthrough lasts three to four hours.
